column2: The Great Palace of Constantinople (Latin: Palatium Magnum), also known as the Sacred Palace (Latin: Sacrum Palatium), is a large Imperial Byzantine palace complex located in the south-eastern end of the peninsula of Constantinople. It serves as the main royal residence of the Eastern Roman or Byzantine emperors and a center of imperial administration.
